Parameters: @B_java#net#InetAddress_E@
InetAddress: the proxy address to set for the APN
setProxyAddress(java.net.InetAddress).Description: use @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#Builder#setProxyAddress_E@ instead. Sets the address of an HTTP proxy for the APN. The proxy address can be an IP address or hostname. If proxy contains both an IP address and hostname, this method ignores the IP address. The @B_java#net#InetAddress_E@ methods @B_java#net#InetAddress#getAllByName_E@ require DNS for hostname resolution. To avoid this requirement when setting a hostname, call @B_java#net#InetAddress#getByAddress_E@ with both the hostname and a dummy IP address. See @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#Builder_E@ for an example.
setProxyAddress(java.net.InetAddress).history: Added in API level 28 Deprecated in API level 29

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: @B_java#lang#String_E@
String: the proxy address to set for the APN This value may be null.
setProxyAddress(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the proxy address of the APN.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: int
int: the Radio Technology (Network Type) info
setNetworkTypeBitmask(int).Description: Sets Radio Technology (Network Type) info for this APN.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: int

int: a bitmask describing the types of the APN Value is either 0 or a combination of @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_DEFAULT_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_MMS_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_SUPL_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_DUN_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_HIPRI_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_FOTA_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_IMS_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_CBS_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_IA_E@, @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_EMERGENCY_E@, and @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#TYPE_MCX_E@
setApnTypeBitmask(int).Description: Sets the bitmask of APN types. Apn types are usage categories for an APN entry. One APN entry may support multiple APN types, eg, a single APN may service regular internet traffic ("default") as well as MMS-specific connections. The bitmask of APN types is calculated from APN types defined in @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting_E@.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: int
int: the MMS proxy port to set for the APN
setMmsProxyPort(int).Description: Sets the MMS proxy port of the APN.

Parameters: @B_java#net#InetAddress_E@
InetAddress: the MMS proxy address to set for the APN
setMmsProxyAddress(java.net.InetAddress).Description: use @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#Builder#setMmsProxyAddress_E@ instead. Sets the address of an MMS proxy for the APN. The MMS proxy address can be an IP address or hostname. If mmsProxy contains both an IP address and hostname, this method ignores the IP address. The @B_java#net#InetAddress_E@ methods @B_java#net#InetAddress#getByName_E@ and @B_java#net#InetAddress#getAllByName_E@ require DNS for hostname resolution. To avoid this requirement when setting a hostname, call @B_java#net#InetAddress#getByAddress_E@ with both the hostname and a dummy IP address. See @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting#Builder_E@ for an example.
setMmsProxyAddress(java.net.InetAddress).history: Added in API level 28 Deprecated in API level 29

ClassDesc: Provides a convenient way to set the fields of a @B_android#telephony#data#ApnSetting_E@ when creating a new instance. The following settings are required to build an ApnSetting: apnTypeBitmask apnName entryName The example below shows how you might create a new ApnSetting:
